intro: Rinorea abidjanensis, commonly known as the Abidjan rinorea, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with violet or purple hues. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Rinorea abidjanensis is adapted to tropical climates and thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
